source_sentence: 彼未退位天龍神鬼敬德歸誠。
translation: 'They've yet to retreat from their position, and gods and spirits revere their virtue and return to them with sincerity.'
When they encounter painful conditions, they retreat from their actions and plot harm.
The gods and others help make it happen quickly.
When he doesn't retreat, he's plotting harm.
Does an arhat also plot harm when he retreats?
A When a post-learner retreats, he doesn't engage in harm.

source_sentence: 由果殊勝雖暫退時行相作業不同學退。
translation: Although the result is excellent, the condition of temporary withdrawal is different from that of training withdrawal.
Q After retreating without training, there's still no harm done.
How could there be harm when he's not yet retired?

source_sentence: 若爾經說當云何通如說羯洛迦孫馱佛訶叱度使魔羅。
translation: If the sūtras say this, how will they be interpreted as the explanation that Krakucchanda Buddha rebuked Māra for causing him to escape?
Should that demon then be plunged into hell?
Answer: He simply rebukes them and doesn't want to harm them.

source_sentence: 然彼業盡自墮地獄曾聞彼佛將一侍者。
translation: However, when his karma is complete, he falls into hell himself. I once heard that the Buddha sent an attendant.
His name was Zhiyuan.
He went into the village of Sālva and begged for food in turn.
The messenger of Māra's deliverance then took the form of a young man.
He threw a stone and struck the attendant from afar.
His head was broken and blood spilled on his face.
He followed the Buddha's lead.
The Buddha then circled to his right like an elephant king.
He looked at this and saw what had happened.
He rebuked Māra and said.
"Why didn't you create this bad karma inappropriately?
When his actions are complete, the demon will fall into hell.
He therefore only rebuked them and didn't want to harm them.

source_sentence: 問諸學謀害為但自為亦為他耶。
translation: Q Do students seek to harm only themselves and others?
Answer Yes, and also for others.

source_sentence: 如昔於此迦濕彌羅國有王都名婫邏吒。
translation: In the past, there was a king's capital in Kāśmīra called Śaurāṭṭha.
Not far from the city, there was a monastery.
It was called Shigya.
There was a monk in there who was an arhat.
On the side of the Siṃghârāma was a man who dyed his own robe.
A man in the city lost a calf.
They searched for it and came here.
They asked the monk far away if he had seen the calf.
He replied that he hadn't seen him.
He gradually moved on.
The monk's activity causes that person to see it.
His robe resembles cowhide and is stained with juice like blood.
It's cooked like a meat container like a cow's head.
He's startled and angry, and he shouts, "You thief!

source_sentence: 如何苾芻盜我犢子而復屠殺。
translation: "How did that monk steal my calf and slaughter it?
He then bound him to the king's palace and sent him away.
The king had the superintendent of the court confine him to prison.
Because of the power of their actions, the disciples were made to remember.
Even though they've gone through a lot of time, they don't remember it.

source_sentence: 惡業盡已彼諸門人皆生憶念。
translation: After their bad karma ended, those disciples all had memories.

source_sentence: 我師何在尋訪乃知禁在牢獄。
translation: 'Where's my teacher?' They looked for him and realized he was confined to a prison.

source_sentence: 便共白王我師無辜枉禁多歲。
translation: They then all told the king that our teacher was innocent and had been imprisoned for many years.
Please let the king examine and release our mentors.
The king then commanded the Dharma minister to quickly release them.
That arhat had been in captivity for a long time.
His clothes were torn, and his hair was long and he didn't look like an ascetic.
The superintendent of the court inspected the monk and didn't see him.
He looked for them and told the king there was no such prisoner.
The disciple reopened the master's office.
He's been imprisoned for many years and has lost his ascetic appearance.
He wished to make the monk declare from the place of confinement.
"Who is this ascetic?" The king graciously released him.
According to his words, the king sought to have it proclaimed.
That arhat's bad karma has ended.
He hears the sound of a call as if he were asleep and awake in a dream.
He ascends into the sky with the power of his supernormal cognition.
He's like a king of gods flying through the sky.
After seeing this, the king throws himself into despair.
He sprinkled his face with cold water for a long time before coming to rest.
"He hurts himself for being ignorant and wrongly banning the noble ones.
He'll fall into a bad destiny with no hope of escape.''
He then saluted the sky with his ministers and thanked them.
"Please let the noble one have mercy on me and forgive my transgressions.
The arhat then bent down and told them.
"I never had anger toward you people.
The king said.
"If that's the case, please take him under your wing.
Venerable Sir, in his kindness, descended into the king's palace.
The king and his ministers rejoiced and praised him.
They shaved their hair and presented them with new robes.
He and his disciples made extensive offerings.
They sent fragrant flowers and floral arrangements to the Kālāma.
There were many sages among his disciples.
The arhat then summoned the crowd and said.
"It's because of my past misfortune that I was unjustly detained.
Don't take it as malice.
Look at that king's capital.
At the time, there was a diligent worker who had attained the fruit of abstraction.
He was too far away to hear those words.
He then followed the monk into the king's capital.
Seeing the master's forbidden place, he secretly became harmful.
That non-citizen forbade those who were taught by their relatives.
Throughout the years, he's endured hardship.
It's really hard to endure this misery.
At the time, there were non-people who respected and believed in the Three Treasures.
They know and diligently guard their mindfulness during this night.
The rainy land filled the city, and everything was destroyed.
Also, in the past, there was a king's capital in this country.
It was called Shanjian, and it wasn't far from there.
There was a saṃgha plant named Zhangshijia.
There were monks there who were arhats.
He went into deep meditation and didn't close his door.
A man in the city had a wife who defected to a temple.
She saw the saṃgha entering meditation and hiding under his bed.
Her husband looked for her and went into the temple to ask the monk about her.
The saṃgha didn't examine him.
He replied that he hadn't seen him.

source_sentence: 夫遂遍求床下捉得夫乃瞋罵云。
translation: The husband then searched everywhere under the bed and caught him. He then angrily rebuked him, saying.
"Thief! Monk!

source_sentence: 如何沙門輒藏我婦縱情。
translation: 'How could a monk hide my wife's conceits so easily?'
He was checked, bound, and sent to the king's office.
The king then instructed the superintendent of the court to explain it in detail as before.
It's different from the previous one.
There's a late renunciant who has realized the fruit of stream-winnerhood.
They then plotted against someone other than themselves and set fire to it.

source_sentence: 燒滅王都故知亦有為他謀害。
translation: It burned down the king's capital. So you know there's also a plot to harm others.
Q: What's the essence of conspiracy to harm among trainees?
A: Thoughts associated with anger are the essence of conspiracy to harm.
The internal condition is called plotting harm.
External dharmas are called resentments.
When external sages are angry with their intentions, it causes a village to be without a village.
It causes a city to be without a city ...
It causes a country to become a country.
As a result, they'll be guilty of violating life.
Why do they both cause villages and so forth to perish?

source_sentence: 外仙得罪內則不爾答外無聖道。
translation: When foreign sages are sinned against, it's not the case on the inside.
The noble path exists inside, and the outside lacks calming and contemplation.
The inner being has stillness and contemplation.
What's outside is harmful, and what's inside is reprimanding.
The outside also initiates applied practices.
The internal simply arouses the mind and says.
"Therefore, external sages won't be blamed by internal ones.
Q Are the students' attempts to harm certain to succeed?
A This is not certain.
If the actions of sentient beings grow, then they won't be accomplished.

source_sentence: 大威勢業異熟現前便不果遂。
translation: When the karma of great authority and power is ripened and manifested, then it won't be accomplished.

source_sentence: 如昔有一婆羅門王名補沙友憎嫉佛法。
translation: For example, there once was a Brāhmaṇa king named Pauṣṭhila who hated the Buddha's teaching.
He burned the scriptures.

source_sentence: 壞窣堵波破僧伽藍害苾芻眾。
translation: He destroyed the stūpa, broke the saṃghârāma, and harmed the congregation of monks.

source_sentence: 於迦濕彌羅國一邊境中。
translation: In one part of Kāśmīra, he destroyed 500 saṃghârāma.

source_sentence: 破五百僧伽藍況於餘處。
translation: He destroyed 500 saṃghârāma, not to mention the other places.

source_sentence: 惡魔方便使鳩叛荼藥叉鬼神冥助威勢。
translation: Through the devil's skillful means, he causes Kumbhâṇḍa, the yakṣa spirits, and ghosts to assist with their authority.
They cause no one to be able to resist them wherever they go.
They gradually extinguish the Buddha's teaching and reach the bodhi tree.
The bodhi tree spirit is called 'truthful speech.'
He had this thought.
'Now, this evil king is a great fool!

source_sentence: 將欲毀壞殑伽沙等諸佛世尊。
translation: He wants to destroy the buddhas and world-honored ones of the Ganges Sands.
He'll destroy the army of Māra and make it a place of marvelous awakening.
He then transformed himself into the body of a remarkable woman.
She stood in front of him.
After he saw her, the king looked into her and became impassioned.
The good Dharma-protecting spirits then got an advantage over him.

source_sentence: 殺王及軍并惡神眾無得免者。
translation: They killed the king, his army, and the host of evil spirits, and there was no one who could escape.
At the time, there were many scholars of the Buddha's teaching.
Even though they plotted against each other, none of them succeeded.
That was because the king's merit was so great.
It's also like the old King Daciaudhva.
He entered Kāśmīra's country.
He disparaged the Buddha's teaching.
He killed the congregation of monks and destroyed the stūpa.
He destroyed the saṃgha temple and burned the scriptures.
At the time, there were many good men and sages in that country.
Even though they plotted against each other, they didn't succeed.
It's because that evil king's merit is great.
This is why it's said.

source_sentence: 若諸有情造作增長大威勢業。
translation: 'If sentient beings create actions that increase their great authority, then maturation will not be accomplished.'
When retribution is manifested, it won't be accomplished.

source_sentence: 說一切有部發智大毘婆沙論卷第一百二十五
translation: Saṃyuktâgama Abhidharma-mahāvibhāṣā-śāstra, vol. 125
